content.description:
This amazing hand crack has a bouldery roof start that can be skipped by using the cheater boulder in front of the crack (resulting in a grade reduction to 5.8). Either way it's climbed, the route is a lot of fun. 

  It can easily be toproped by climbing up the easy ramp located on the left side of the boulder formation.
content.protection: (2) #1, (2) #2, and (1) #3 Camalot protect this climb very well. A crash pad is definitely helpful if you plan on doing the roof crack start. (2) #3 and a #2 Camalot for a gear anchor if you wish to toprope. No fixed anchors.
content.location: This is the obvious crack located on the northern face of the Lizardhead boulders.

climbs.name: Learning To Fly
climbs.fa: Mike Head (Free Solo) | Mike Lewis (TR) | Larry Spears, Phil Broscovik (Original Hardware) | Clint Brooks (Re-established)

content.description: Use the boulder to the Left of Jessie's Day Off to gain the ledge, then finish direct. Can be TR'd off JDO's anchor.
content.protection: 2 Face Bolts | 2 Anchor Bolts (Easily Accessible from Top)
content.location: Around the corner from Pumper #9 at Lizardhead Boulders

content.description: Left-leaning crack with some good jams and some face moves.
content.protection: Small to Medium gear.  Gear anchor with easy access.
content.location: To the left of Gilory's Gully in between the boulders.

climbs.name: Jessie's Day Off
climbs.fa: TR'd by Mike Lewis | Bolted by Larry Spears, Phil Broscovik | Chopped by Park Staff | Re-Bolted by Clint Brooks

content.description: A seriously tough start! A low left foot makes for a crumbly smear, but a high right will let you reach an obvious crystal. Tall-people-beta would make this significantly easier. There are a couple good hand holds to choose from for clipping the first bolt. The second bolt's clipping stance is a no-brainer from the ledge. After that, climb just past your waist-high protection to pull the slightly-overhanging finish! It's recommended to just top this one out if you're on lead, otherwise your anchor's going to be in the way when you're searching for those tiny nubbins.
content.protection: 2 face bolts | 2 anchor bolts (easily accessible for setting up TR anchor)
content.location: Far right side of the West Face | Around the corner from Pumper #9 | Between Carnivore Boulders, Loop Boulders, and Safe Harbor

content.description: Dihedral with lot's of stemming and some fun liebacks.
content.protection: Small gear for lead.  Large gear for TR anchor.  Anchor access from either direction.
content.location: To the left of Pumper #9.  Through the cave and in the dihedral.

content.description: Climbs are north facing, some completely shaded in a rock passage. Very secluded due to being somewhat hard to find. Rock quality is very good and features several cracks and a few face climbs.
